The Wasserman Center is here to help make those first steps as easy as possible. There may be a lot to accomplish - let us help you take it one step at a time.                             Preparing for the Job Search:        Resumes, Cover Letters,          Interviewing & Networking                                         Find a Job or Internship:        NYU CareerNet,          On-Campus Employment & Recruitment                                         Career Fairs:        Make the Most          Out of Career Fairs                                              Eligible NYU Schools     The Wasserman Career Development Center is open to all New York University undergraduate and graduate degree candidates* and alumni from the Center for Urban Science and Progress · College of Arts and Science · College of Nursing · Gallatin School of Individualized Study · Global Public Health Program · Graduate School of Arts and Science · Liberal Studies · Polytechnic School of Engineering · Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service · School of Professional Studies (including Graduate Certificates) · Silver School of Social Work · Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development · Stern School of Business (Undergraduate only) · Tisch School of the Arts.     * Stern School of Business (Graduate) , School of Law , School of Medicine, and College of Dentistry students are eligible for assistance with alternative careers.          School-Specific Career Services Offices   Students from the following schools are encouraged to use the resources at the Wasserman Center and also at their school's career center.   » The Wasserman Center | School of Professional Studies     » Tisch School of the Arts   » Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service              Main Office        Office Hours     Monday & Friday  9am-5pm   Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday   9am - 7pm        Walk-in Hours     Monday : 2:30pm-4pm   Tuesday : 12pm-1:30pm & 2:30pm-4pm   Wednesday : 2:30pm-4pm & 5pm-6:30pm   Thursday : 2:30pm-4pm & 5pm-6:30pm   Friday : 12pm-1:30pm   Graduate Student Walk-in Hours*   Tuesdays: 5pm-6:30pm   Fridays: 2pm-3:30pm  *Graduate students may also visit walk-in hours during the hours listed above.               Brooklyn Office        Office Hours     Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday  9am-5pm   Wednesday  9am-7pm          Walk-in Hours     Monday: 2:30pm-4pm   Tuesday: 2:30pm-4pm   Wednesday: 5pm-6:30pm   Thursday: 2:30pm-4pm   Friday: 12pm-1:30pm               School of Professional Studies Office        Office Hours   Monday, Tuesday, Thursday  9am-7pm   Wednesday & Friday  9am-5pm          Walk-in Hours   Monday : 3pm-4:30pm   Tuesday : 12pm-1:30pm   Wednesday : 12pm-1:30pm   Thursday : 3pm-4:30pm   Friday : 12pm-1:30pm               Holiday Hours   The Wasserman Center for Career Development will be closed in accordance with the University holiday and recess schedule .                                             Attention Class of 2015 & 2016        Resume Book Collection is here                   Have your resume viewed by hundreds of employers hiring for full-time positions. Read More                                   Reserve a Conference Room                  Multi-media enabled spaces are available for your next conference, seminar, or training session.            Read More                   eNewsletters   Subscribe to our industry-specific career eNewsletters to receive weekly events, jobs, and career resources of interest to you.              Virtual Chat   Have your career questions answered in real time by chatting with a career coach online. To access the virtual career chat feature, log in to NYU CareerNet and click "Chat with a Career Coach". Virtual chat is available:       Mondays: 2:30pm-4pm, EST     Tuesdays: 12pm-1:30pm, EST     Thursdays: 3:30pm-5pm, EST                Contact Us     Main Office   133 East 13th Street, 2nd Floor  (212) 998-4730 | career.development@nyu.edu     Brooklyn Office   311 Bridge Street (The Wunsch Building)  (718) 260-3650 | career.development@nyu.edu   School of Professional Studies Office   7 East 12th Street, Suite 829  (212) 998-7205 | sps.wasserman@nyu.edu   www.sps.nyu.edu/career     Meet our staff                Follow Us                                                                            NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. Read more        University   Provides opportunities through challenging work assignments, the opportunity to apply for new work assignments, and formal and informal training. Read more        Employee   Manage your career and seek out opportunities and challenges that will help you progress toward achieving your limitless career aspirations.
